articles.title: 20 Dead in Argentina After Taking Opioids-Laced Cocaine, Cops Suspect 'War' Between Drug Traffickers
articles.description: Officials said they were working quickly to determine what the cocaine was mixed with, but warned those who bought the drug over the last 24 hours to dispose of it.
articles.content:
At least 20 people died and 74 more were hospitalized in a Buenos Aires suburb after consuming cocaine cut with a toxic substance, possibly opioids, Argentine authorities said Wednesday.

articles.title: Tainted cocaine kills 20 in Argentina with dozens more hospitalised
articles.description: Local media reported the drug had been ‘cut’ with a toxic substance as authorities said it might have been intentional
articles.content:
At least 20 people have died in Argentina and dozens have been hospitalised after consuming cocaine suspected of containing a poisonous substance, authorities in Buenos Aires province, at the centre of the incident, said.

articles.title: At least 17 dead after consuming 'poisoned cocaine'
articles.description: It is thought that the cocaine was poisoned as part of a settling of scores between traffickers in Argentina's Buenos Aires province.
articles.content:
At least 17 people are dead and 56 are in hospital after using what is thought to have been poisoned cocaine.
The cases are clustered around several towns in Buenos Aires province, Argentina's most populous.
Samples of the drug are being analysed but... [1242 chars]

articles.title: Tainted cocaine kills 16 in Argentina, dozens hospitalized
articles.description: Provincial security forces detained some people suspected of selling the drug after the first deaths occurred on Wednesday. Some local media outlets reported that the cocaine had been "cut" with a toxic substance, likely by a drug gang looking to cut costs amid a turf war with rival groups.
